page.title: 05Events & Customs:Chinnor etc
page.content: Every Easter there is an Easter Parade organised by St Andrew's School when a procession of children, adults and decorated floats passes through the village streets. 'Egg Jarping' used to take occur but has ceased. Easter Egg and Bonnet competions take place; these are held at Mill Lane School. At the latter school on May Day, maypole dancing takes place, two kings and queens are crowned and traditional dances are performed by the children. Sydenham Fayre, originally held to celebrate Harvest, was recommenced five years ago. There are displays of rural arts and crafts as well as the usual stalls. Proceeds go to various charities. Harvest Festivals are held at all churches and in both schools. Christian Aid is also an annual event.
